Jim Henson: Imagination with [No] Strings Attached

Sewing Together the Pieces

Jim Henson was one of the most prolific and imaginative creators of vividly realistic worlds as well as the puppets who filled them. Below is just a sampling of his life and achievements throughout it:


  • 1936 - Henson is born in Greenville Mississippi

  • 1954 - First puppet performance on Washington D.C.'s WTOP-TV while still in high school

  • 1955 - Henson performs his own 5-minute show twice daily called Sam and Friends featuring an early version of Kermit the Frog

  • 1961 - Future wife and collaborator Jane Nebel introduces Henson to another major collaborator: Jerry Juhl

  • 1963 - Jim and Jane move their family to New York City

  • 1969 - The first episode of Sesame Street premieres on television featuring Ernie and Bert, Oscar the Grouch, Grover, Cookie Monster, and Big Bird

  • Henson and Sesame Street move to ATV Studios and add Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear, Animal, Gonzo, Lew Zeland, and Rizzo the Rat

  • 1982 - One of Henson's other puppet movies, The Dark Crystal is released

  • 1986 - Henson works on Labyrinth with George Lucas & David Bowie

  • 1984 - Muppet Babies makes its television debut before going on to win 4 consecutive Emmys for Henson

  • 1990 - Henson passes away May 16th before seeing the completion of his Disney World attraction Muppets 3D

For more information on Jim Henson visit The Jim Henson Company Page or Jim Henson's Wikipedia page.
